package.name: Validate_US
package.description: Package to validate various datas. It includes : * numbers (min/max, decimal or not) * email (syntax, domain check) * string (predifined type alpha upper and/or lowercase, numeric,...) * date (min, max) * Credit cards * uri (RFC2396) * possibility valid multiple data with a single method call (::multiple) * Locale validation for AT, CH, DE, ES, FR, NL, PL, ptBR, UK, US * Finance (e.g. IBAN)

release.notes:
- Split from Validate into independent package - CS fixes - region() added in US (that is validation of the states) - phoneNumber() added. - BC break! postalCode unified between countries (name wise), now all postcode validation funcs are named postalCode - Added test cases for some of the functions - Added a var named $high_groups which will stores result of a query to a webpage that ssnGetHighGroups does to get list of all high groups, that will really help getting load if there is a need to validate more then one ssn in a row.
Note! SSNs that end with 0000 will be taken as invalid at the moment, because as far as we know this isn't allowed. Example: 019880000 If this is indeed allowed then please open up a bug report about that.
